actions.committee: Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs (Subsequently: Energy and Natural Resources)
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs (Subsequently: Energy and Natural Resources).
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources with amendment, S. Rept. 95-803.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend the Act of October 20, 1976, relating to payments to local governments based upon certain public lands within the boundaries of the jurisdiction of such governments, to include payments for lands on which certain semiactive or inactive military installations are located.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Includes, effective October 1, 1978, lands on which specified semiactive or inactive military installations are located, not including industrial installations, which have been retained by the Army for mobilization purposes and for support of reserve component training, in the list of public lands which entitle local governments to payments by the Secretary of the Interior based on the amount of such lands within the boundaries of such locality. Provides that payments in lieu of taxes are not to be made to any unit of local government for any lands which were owned or administered by a State or unit of local government and were exempt from the payment of real estate taxes at the time such lands were conveyed to the United States. Provides that units of local government located outside the boundaries or organized boroughs in the State of Alaska which act as the collecting or distributing agency for real property taxes shall be eligible to receive such payments in lieu of taxes, beginning in fiscal year 1979.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Act of October 20, 1976, relating to payments to local governments based upon certain public lands within the boundaries of the jurisdiction of such governments, to include payments for lands on which certain semiactive or inactive military installations are located.
